key.name: board-color
key.description: Hex color used for the game board background.

key.name: smart-move-mode
key.description: Whether Smart Move is disabled, uses single click, or uses double click.

key.name: spider-suit-mode
key.description: Number of suits for Spider deals (1-4).

key.name: freecell-card-count-mode
key.description: Number of cards for FreeCell deals (26, 39, or 52).

key.name: freecell-cell-count
key.description: Number of free cells shown at the top in FreeCell (1-6).

key.name: chess-board-rotation-degrees
key.description: Visual board rotation angle used in chess modes. Valid values: 0,45,180,270.

key.name: chess-ai-strength
key.description: Search profile for chess auto-response moves. Valid values: fast, balanced, strong, ultra, ludicrous, omega, extra-dimensional, international, grandeur.

key.name: chess-wand-ai-strength
key.description: Search profile for your manual Wand Wave clicks in chess. Valid values: fast, balanced, strong, ultra, ludicrous, omega, extra-dimensional, international, grandeur.

key.name: chess-w-question-ai-strength
key.description: Search profile for W? chess analysis. Valid values: fast, balanced, strong, ultra, ludicrous, omega, extra-dimensional, international, grandeur.

key.name: chess-robot-white-ai-strength
key.summary: Chess robot white AI strength profile
key.description: Search profile used when Robot controls White in chess. Valid values: fast, balanced, strong, ultra, ludicrous, omega, extra-dimensional, international, grandeur.

key.name: chess-robot-black-ai-strength
key.summary: Chess robot black AI strength profile
key.description: Search profile used when Robot controls Black in chess. Valid values: fast, balanced, strong, ultra, ludicrous, omega, extra-dimensional, international, grandeur.

key.name: chess-wand-ai-opponent-auto-response
key.description: When enabled, after your chess move the opponent side auto-plays one Wand AI move.

key.name: chess-auto-response-plays-white
key.description: When enabled, Wand auto-response only triggers when White is the responding side.

key.name: chess-auto-flip-board-each-move
key.description: When enabled, chess board orientation auto-flips to the side to move after each move.

key.name: chess-show-board-coordinates
key.description: When enabled, A-H and 1-8 coordinate markers are shown on the outer edge of the chess board.

key.name: chess-system-sounds-enabled
key.description: When enabled, chess moves trigger a system alert bell with built-in rate limiting.

key.name: saved-session
key.description: Serialized game/session state used for crash-safe resume on next launch.

key.name: custom-userstyle-css
key.description: Optional custom CSS applied on top of Cardthropic board styles.

key.name: saved-custom-userstyle-css
key.description: Last saved Custom CSS text, kept even when theme presets are active.

key.name: custom-userstyle-word-wrap
key.description: Whether the Custom CSS editor wraps long lines.

key.name: enable-hud
key.description: Show the toolbar area above the stock/waste/foundations row.

key.name: forever-mode
key.description: When enabled, Robot Mode keeps running across outcomes and reseeds.

key.name: ludicrous-speed
key.description: When enabled, Robot Mode runs at 40 milliseconds per move.

key.name: robot-debug-enabled
key.description: When enabled, automation status strings include advanced robot and planner diagnostics.

key.name: robot-strict-debug-invariants
key.description: When enabled, Robot Mode runs additional debug-only state invariant checks and stops immediately on violations.

key.name: robot-auto-new-game-on-loss
key.summary: Robot auto new game on loss
key.description: When enabled, normal Robot Mode automatically starts a new random game after a loss.

key.name: interface-emoji-font
key.description: Optional font family override used for UI text and emoji. Empty uses the app/system default font.

key.name: seed-history
key.description: Serialized per-seed play and win history used by the seed dropdown.

key.name: close-palette-on-command
key.summary: Close command palette after executing a command
key.description: When enabled, command palette closes after a command is invoked.

key.name: command-palette-width
key.description: Last remembered width for the command palette window.

key.name: command-palette-height
key.description: Last remembered height for the command palette window.

key.name: command-palette-maximized
key.description: Whether the command palette window was maximized when last closed.

key.name: command-palette-query
key.description: Last query text entered in the command palette search box.

key.name: status-history-width
key.description: Last remembered width for the status history window.

key.name: status-history-height
key.description: Last remembered height for the status history window.

key.name: status-history-maximized
key.description: Whether the status history window was maximized when last closed.

key.name: status-history-retention-lines
key.description: Maximum number of status history lines retained in memory.

key.name: theme-presets-width
key.description: Last remembered width for the theme presets window.

key.name: theme-presets-height
key.description: Last remembered height for the theme presets window.

key.name: theme-presets-maximized
key.description: Whether the theme presets window was maximized when last closed.

key.name: apm-graph-width
key.description: Last remembered width for the APM graph window.

key.name: apm-graph-height
key.description: Last remembered height for the APM graph window.

key.name: apm-graph-maximized
key.description: Whether the APM graph window was maximized when last closed.

key.name: help-width
key.description: Last remembered width for the help window.

key.name: help-height
key.description: Last remembered height for the help window.

key.name: help-maximized
key.description: Whether the help window was maximized when last closed.

key.name: first-launch-intro-shown
key.description: Whether Cardthropic already showed the first-launch welcome help introduction.

key.name: memory-guard-enabled
key.description: When enabled, Cardthropic monitors process memory and applies soft/hard guard actions.

key.name: memory-guard-soft-limit-mib
key.description: Soft memory threshold in MiB. Crossing it stops automation and attempts memory trim.

key.name: memory-guard-hard-limit-mib
key.description: Hard memory threshold in MiB. Crossing it saves session and exits gracefully.
